title: Introduction to Music
content: Children are introduced to simple sounds and rhythms. They clap their hands, tap on objects, and sing short songs. Music helps them develop listening skills and creativity.

title: Singing Simple Songs
content: Pupils sing short songs like 'Twinkle Twinkle Little Star'. Singing builds memory, fun, and confidence.

title: Sounds & Rhythms
content: Children learn to clap, tap, or stamp in rhythm. They repeat sounds after the teacher.

title: Using Simple Instruments
content: Pupils play toy drums, rattles, or shakers. This develops motor skills and sense of beat.

title: Listening to Sounds
content: Children listen carefully to sounds of animals, cars, and nature. They try to imitate them.

title: Introduction to Rhymes
content: Children enjoy rhymes like 'Baa Baa Black Sheep'. Rhymes improve language and memory.

title: Clap and Sing
content: Children clap their hands while singing a rhyme. This builds rhythm and fun.

title: Current Affairs for Kids
content: Children learn about what is happening around them: school events, weather, and celebrations.

title: Knowing Community Helpers
content: Children learn about people who help us like teachers, doctors, and farmers.

title: Daily Routine
content: Children talk about daily routines like waking up, going to school, and sleeping.
